intro: Cheiloclinium serratum, commonly known as the serrated cheiloclinium, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, opposite leaves with serrated edges. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, clustered in small inflorescences. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories or along stream banks.
